intro: Phanera surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam phanera, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
